page.title: 15Chipstead NE & Coulsdon SW.
page.content: This km. square is divided in two by a North/South line drawn through it. To the west of the line lies NE Chipstead where most of the housing in Chipstead is concentrated. This consists of very expensive private residences owned by city executives. To the east is SW Coulsdon, which is naturally divided by Rickman Hill. On the east side the houses are similar to the above and on the west side an area of council housing. The council houses are occupied by families with children of school age and older. Since there are many young people in the area, the facilities for them have increased: a youth club in Portnalls Rd. and discos at St. Frances' Ch., Rickman Hill. The recreation ground: Rickman Hill Park is used for Sunday league football and for friendly matches.
